custom_fields.key_topics: Language, communication, pragmatic skill development in speaking, reading, writing, and listening, and cultural knowledge.
custom_fields.prerequisite_knowledge: No prerequisite although taking the placement test is required for anyone with prior knowledge of the language.
custom_fields.assessment_structure: Class participation, homework, quizzes, unit/chapter exams, presentations, oral exams/meetings; meetings with a speaking or writing peer assistant. Final exams are course dependent.
custom_fields.goals: To communicate, learn moderate control of grammar, vocabulary, and pronunciation to understand the importance of cultural information in language and pragmatics. They do so primarily through the use of isolated words, phrases, and sentences that have been encountered, memorized, and recalled. They will also be able to build their knowledge of French language and culture.
custom_fields.relevance: This elementary level course introduces and extends students' abilities to communicate in the target language. Students can achieve up to Intermediate Low (ACTFL) or the A2 level (CEFR: European framework).
custom_fields.learning_resources: Depending on the course, textbooks, online resources, materials provided by instructors. For the online courses, all course material is provided through the Open Learning Initiative (oli.cmu.edu).

long_desc: This course is for students with no prior experience in French. Using a proficiencyoriented approach, students will develop contextually appropriate interpersonal communication skills in both written and spoken French, develop reading and listening skills through the use of various media, understand fundamental grammar, acquire vocabulary, and gain a basic understanding of French and francophone cultures through class activities. Regular homework, quizzes, tests, presentations, and class participation are mandatory four inclass hours per week. The elementary level is also designed to help students learn to reflect and draw upon strategies used by good language learners in their second language study. A student with prior experience in French must take the placement exam.
name: Elementary French I
